jobs.title: Conference & Events Sales Executive ( Saudi Nationals only)
jobs.aboutus:
Welcome to IHG.  Now that you’re part of our family, let’s explain the role you will play.  What’s the job?

 

Develop and generate business leads supporting hotel revenue in rooms, F&B, & C&E targets, achieving personal targets and contributing in overall hotel revenue targets, participate in department reports generation, meetings and initiatives. Ensure applying IHG winning ways including IWOS. Regularly sell hotel rooms, meeting rooms, and food and beverage through direct client contacts.

At Crowne Plaza we look for people who are dynamic, confident and ambitious; people who excel in their role and help our guests succeed too.

Sales Executive   

Your day-to-day

People

  • Manage day-to-day personal sales activities, including a stream-lined business/deals/contracts/events handover to all concerned parties in sales and other departments. 
  • Participate and support sales team in implementing sales strategies.
  • Participate in training new sales colleagues.
  • Work in close coordination with other departments to ensure best service is offered to all hotel guests.
  • Carry out daily administrative / reporting tasks required i.e. forecasts, sales activity, productivity, and other duties and special projects as assigned.  Analyse any variance on production for all accounts managed, plan and implement corrective action as required. 
  • Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments.

Financial

  • Achieve budgeted revenues and personal sales goals and maximise profitability. Participate in the execution of the departmental plan, the hotel marketing plan, business plan. 
  • Create and implement personal sales plans, support the department director and sales team in executing tactical plans that drive measurable incremental occupancy, increase average rates, increase volume, food and beverage and banquet sales.
  • Generate revenue from sponsorships when applicable throughout the hotel and in all opportunities, focus on renting out all vacant venues with the highest returns.   
  • Establish customer base of individuals, organisations, associations, social and/or corporate businesses through direct sales activities to secure business for the hotel and ensure that total revenue goals are met or exceeded.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key clients, all major business sources, and all international and regional distribution channels to further develop opportunities for all hotel products.
  • Produce daily, weekly, and monthly reports and sales forecasts to analyse current/potential market and sales trends, coordinate activities to increase revenue and market share and monitor personal performance to ensure actual sales meet or exceed established individual and departmental financial goals.
  •  Negotiate food and beverage prices, function space, and hotel services within approved departmental booking guidelines.

Guest Experience 

  • Provide guests with information (example: loyalty programmes, area attractions, restaurants, facility information) to enhance guest experience. 
  • Arrange and conduct off-site presentations and site inspections for potential customers.  Entertain customers in accordance with established company and hotel policies and guidelines.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts in order to produce corporate, governmental, group and/or convention business, including rooms, food & beverage, and catering/banquet sales. 
  • Conduct banquet and catering facility tours and entertain clients to enhance the guests’ meeting/banquet experience. 
  • In the pre-event planning process, consult with the meeting planners to identify optimal meeting room configuration, recommendation on meeting/break flow, menu planning, food and beverage coordination, table arrangements, decoration options, etc. to improve meeting efficiency and productivity.  
  • Arrange all details of meetings and conventions to include room set-ups, staging, lighting, audiovisual, traffic flow, menus, décor, entertainment, group room blocks, transportation, billing instructions and VIP services.
  • Meet with each meeting planner daily to debrief on daily events, review consumption, bill and any exceptions to contracted billing and review estimates of final billing.
  • Plan and conduct pre-event and post-event meetings with clients and catering staff to determine potential enhancements to the guest experience. 
  • Analyse and action against client satisfaction surveys to improve services.

 

Responsible Business

  • Coordinate safety and security initiatives to ensure meetings flow smoothly with minimal interruptions or problems. Coach and advise clients on meeting options and alternatives that potentially reduce waste, save energy and have a minimal impact to the environment.
  • Develop awareness and reputation of the hotel and the brand in the local community.
  • Perform other duties as assigned. May also serve as manager on duty.

Accountability

1) Achieve budgeted revenues and personal sales goals and maximise profitability.

2) Produce daily, weekly, and monthly reports and sales forecasts to analyse current/potential market and sales trends.

3) Develop and maintain relationships with key clients, all major business sources, and all international and regional distribution channels to further develop opportunities for all hotel products.

4) Develop awareness and reputation of the hotel and the brand in the local community.

5) Generate revenue from prospect leads when applicable throughout the hotel and in all opportunities with the maximum conversion ratio, focus on renting out all vacant venues with the highest returns. 

 

What we need from you

 

Bachelor’s degree / higher education qualification / equivalent in marketing or related field, and two to four years of experience in a hospitality or hotel sales and marketing setting with direct supervisory experience over a sales team, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. 

 

  • Must speak local language.  
  • Other languages must.
How do I deliver this?

We genuinely care about people and we show this through living out our promise of True Hospitality each and every day. It’s what connects every colleague in all IHG hotels.

 

Each IHG® hotel brand delivers True Hospitality in their own way, and at the heart of it all are specific, core service skills.

  • True Attitude: being caring, wanting to make a positive difference, and building genuine connections with guests 
  • True Confidence: having the knowledge and skills to perform your role, and giving guests the confidence that they can trust you, to help and support them during their stay
  • True Listening: focusing on what your guest is saying, picking up on body language that is often overlooked, and understanding what the guest wants and needs
  • True Responsiveness: is about providing guests with what they need, and doing so in a timely and caring manner

The statements in this job description are intended to represent the key duties and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be ALL responsibilities or qualifications of the job

Bachelor’s degree / higher education qualification / equivalent in marketing or related field, and two to four years of experience in a hospitality or hotel sales and marketing setting with direct supervisory experience over a sales team, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. 

 

  • Must speak local language.  
  • Other languages must.
How do I deliver this?

We genuinely care about people and we show this through living out our promise of True Hospitality each and every day. It’s what connects every colleague in all IHG hotels.

 

Each IHG® hotel brand delivers True Hospitality in their own way, and at the heart of it all are specific, core service skills.

  • True Attitude: being caring, wanting to make a positive difference, and building genuine connections with guests 
  • True Confidence: having the knowledge and skills to perform your role, and giving guests the confidence that they can trust you, to help and support them during their stay
  • True Listening: focusing on what your guest is saying, picking up on body language that is often overlooked, and understanding what the guest wants and needs
  • True Responsiveness: is about providing guests with what they need, and doing so in a timely and caring manner

The statements in this job description are intended to represent the key duties and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be ALL responsibilities or qualifications of the job

jobs.title: Director of Sales & Marketing
jobs.aboutus:
We are looking for a dynamic Director of Sales & Marketing with the strategic nous and the drive to meet our sales goals consistently.

 

Your Role:

As the Director of Sales & Marketing, your day-to-day responsibilities will vary, but will primarily include:

  • Overseeing daily sales operations and mentoring your team to unleash their full potential.
  • Achieving both personal and team sales targets to enhance our profitability.
  • Developing and executing sales strategies that lead to measurable increases in occupancy, improved average rates, and expanded sales across rooms, food & beverage, and banquet services.
  • Generating and analyzing monthly reports to track and improve performance.
  • Spearheading marketing initiatives to promote hotel services, offerings, and amenities to guests.

 

What We Expect From You:

  • Proven Experience: Demonstrable experience in the hospitality or hotel industry, preferably with a prior role as a Director of Sales & Marketing.
  • Industry Acumen: A successful track record with international luxury brands in Southeast Asia or North Asia.
  • Communication Skills: Fluent in English, with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization.

 

What You Can Expect from Us:


We are committed to empowering our team members with everything they need for success. This includes:

  • A competitive salary that reflects your contributions.
  • A comprehensive benefits package that supports your best work-life balance, including significant room discounts and industry-leading training.

At IHG Hotels & Resorts, we embrace diversity and inclusion, encouraging our team members to be their authentic selves at work. We are proud to offer equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status. Our culture is one of trust, support, and acceptance, valuing diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

Joining IHG means becoming part of a global family that prioritizes your growth and well-being. Our collaborative environment is designed to foster belonging and make a real difference. With our myWellbeing framework, we are dedicated to supporting your health, lifestyle, and workplace well-being.

Apply today to become an integral part of our all-star team and global family.
